feedback.p: Correct. The antibody for the primary immune response is usually IgM while that for the secondary is IgG.
Incorrect. IgD is only found transiently on the surface of B cells as they mature.
Correct. Pentamer means 5, so a pentameric antibody has the potential to bind 5 antigens while a monomer has the potential to only bind one antigen molecule.
Incorrect. A monomer can only bind on antigen or epitope, a pentimer can bind several.
Correct. IgM is the antibody secreted for the primary antibody response and IgA is found in the secretions associated with mucus membranes.
Correct. IgA is the dimer found in many bodily fluids.
Incorrect. IgE is a monomer which is usually secreted as part of an allergy reaction.
